      • addEntry

        public void addEntry(java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.String address,
                     java.lang.String phoneNumber,
                     java.lang.String email,
                     java.lang.String note)
        void addEntry(String name, String address, String phoneNumber,String email, String note): Add a new entry into the Phonebook. Arguments accepted in the form of Strings. Entry with a duplicate 'name' field is not allowed. Other fields may or may not have duplicates.
        Parameters:
        name - : type String - Holds the name of the contact, no limit on length
        address - : type String - Holds the address of the contact, no limit on length
        phoneNumber - : type String - Holds the Phone Number of the contact, no limit on length
        email - : type String - Holds the email of the contact, no limit on length
        note - : type String - Holds a note, no limit on length
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when Phonebook already contains entry with name given as argument

      • deleteEntry

        public void deleteEntry(java.lang.String name)
        void deleteEntry(String name): Delete an entry from the Phonebook
        Parameters:
        name - - type String, name of the contact that has to be deleted
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the entry being deleted is not present in the Phonebook

      • searchEntry

        public java.util.List<com.nyu.pqs.probSet1.PhonebookEntry> searchEntry(java.lang.String field,
                                                                       java.lang.String value)
                                                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        List searchEntry(String field,String value): Searches for an entry in the Phonebook with the value of the respective field. Returns a list of Phonebook objects if one or more contacts found that match the search criteria. Else an empty list is returned.
        Parameters:
        field - - type String, name of the field to be looked into (example :- name, email etc.)
        value - - type String, value of the search string
        Returns:
        List of type PhonebookEntry
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when argument is invalid

      • writeToFile

        public void writeToFile(java.lang.String filepath)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        void writeToFile(String filepath): Serializes the current object with its data to a file specified by the user.
        Parameters:
        filepath, - type String - path where the file is to be saved
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when I/O operation fails

      • readFromFile

        public static Phonebook readFromFile(java.lang.String filePath)
                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                     java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Phonebook readFromFile(String filepath): Deserializes object of type Phonebook from a file specified by the user. Has to be a file created by the writeToFile function containing serialized Phonebook object data.
        Parameters:
        filePath - - type String - path where the file is read from
        Returns:
        Phonebook Object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when argument is invalid
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - when class being loaded is not found
